dojg.description: A Wh-word that asks about the amount of something.

examples.japanese: (ksa).東京の3DKのマンションはいくらぐらいですか。
examples.english: Approximately how much is a 3DK (3 rooms with a dining room /  kitchen) apartment in Tokyo?

examples.japanese: (ksb).いくら働いてもお金が貯まらない。
examples.english: No matter how much I work I can't save money.

examples.japanese: (ksc).夏休みだから時間はいくらでもある。
examples.english: It's summer vacation, so I have tons of time.

examples.japanese: (ksd).ミルクはもういくらも残っていない。
examples.english: There is barely any milk left.

examples.japanese: (kse).今日はいくらか気分がいい。
(b).A:寄付はいくらぐらいすればいいでしょうか。        B:いくらでも結構です。
examples.english: A: About how much money should I donate?      B: Any amount would be ﬁne.

examples.japanese: (c).いくら時間とお金をかけてもそのプロジェクトは終わるまい。
examples.english: No matter how much time and money we spend on this project, it  probably won't end.

examples.japanese: (d).会議はいくら長くても一時間ぐらいだろう。
examples.english: The meeting should last for an hour at the most (literally: no  matter how long it may last).

examples.japanese: (e).いくら頭脳明晰でもよき指導者になれるとは限らない。
examples.english: No matter how bright someone is they won't necessarily become a  good leader.

examples.japanese: (f).お酒はいくらでもありますから、どうぞたくさん飲んで下さい。
examples.english: There is really plenty of sake, so please drink as much as you  like.

examples.japanese: (g).私はまだ経験が浅いので報酬はいくらでもいいです。
examples.english: I don't have much experience, so any amount of compensation is  ﬁne.

examples.japanese: (h).寄付はいくらでも大丈夫です。
examples.english: As for donations, any amount will be ﬁne.

examples.japanese: (i).僕みたいに毎日泳いでいる人間はいくらもいない。
examples.english: Very few people swim every day like I do.

examples.japanese: (j).我々のように、いくらも休みがない人間だと、どんなに山登りをしたくても時間がないのである。
examples.english: People like us who don't have many days off can't afford the  time to climb mountains, no matter how much we'd like to.
